div.p: 1. The most general term for relative rank of any kind in any walk of life is děng 等.
2. Jiē 階, jí 級. and the rarer bān 班 are general terms referring to a person's position in the bureaucratic hierarchy.
3. Wèi 位 and the rarer liè 列 typically refer to relatively elevated official ranks only.
4. Jué 爵 refers specifically to noble rank.
5. Shàng 上 is occasionally used to refer to leading position.
階，官爵的等級，後特指 “ 品 ” 下的等級或散官的品級。
班，位次；作動詞，安排等級。
位，泛指尊卑等級、官位爵位；特指君王的職位。
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: 中國文化背景八千詞 Zhongguo wenhua beijing ba qian ci

entry.def: Shàng 上 is occasionally used to refer to leading position.

sense.def: 秦伯third of the feudal ranks, 公侯伯子男，"earl"

entry.def: Wèi 位 and the rarer liè 列 typically refer to relatively elevated official ranks only.

sense.def: rank > stage, level (of development, attainment, etc.)
(abstract, not narrowly bureaucratic:) (social) position, or seat in the hierarchy (high or low)
one's concrete rank in the hierarchy; respectable formal position in society

entry.def: Gōng 公 has many related meanings, but when following after the name of a state the word refers specifically to the ruler of an enfeoffed kingdom under the Son of Heaven who belongs to the royal lineage. After personal names, or used absolutely, the word may generally refer to to rulers of any rank and might be fastidiously translated as "his lordship".

sense.def: ruler - not necessarily of the status of a Duke
州公 Duke is not here an enfeoffment title of the Zhōu, but presumably of the Shāng (See 日知錄 p. 566)
His Excellency (applied posthumously to any deceased member of the 諸侯 group) 桓公 Bronze inscriptions have this 公 after deceased persons below 諸侯 rank. [JM]
ruler of a state of any of the five ranks 公侯伯子男. (This designation must not be confused with the formal rank of a 公 "Duke".
duke of the contextually determinate N; ruler (of any rank) of N
the duke of the speaker's state

entry.def: Wèi 位 and the rarer liè 列 typically refer to relatively elevated official ranks only.

sense.def: formal rank, rank, level of political appointment
ranked; alligned; established in proper order
establish in a formal high rank; get established in formal rank; be ranked among
be established in proper order; be lined up in proper order
viscount (NB: title of rulers of Chǔ)

entry.def: Jué 爵 refers specifically to noble rank.

sense.def: official high formal rank; appointments to official ranks

entry.def: Jiē 階, jí 級. and the rarer bān 班 are general terms referring to a person's position in the bureaucratic hierarchy.

sense.def: be of the same rank; to equal,
lowest of the five aristocratic ranks: barons
official ranking in the order of honours

entry.def: The most general term for relative rank of any kind in any walk of life is děng 等 .

sense.def: arrange (somebody or something) into ranks; classify (something or somebody)

entry.def: Jiē 階, jí 級. and the rarer bān 班 are general terms referring to a person's position in the bureaucratic hierarchy.

sense.def: civil or military rank; degree (in the ranking system), level of ranking, grade in the official hierarchy

entry.def: Jiē 階, jí 級. and the rarer bān 班 are general terms referring to a person's position in the bureaucratic hierarchy.

sense.def: rank and position; ranks or positions of any kind
the rank of the contextually determinate N
salary and rank; one's concrete position in the hierarchy associated with a certain salary level

bibl.title: 佛教語大辭典 Bukkyōgo daijiten Encyclopedic Dictionary of Buddhist Terms

sense.def: BUDDH: stand-in place > the rank/position where one awaits to be the next Buddha (> the next Buddha)
BUDDH: of/concerning the rank of a Bodhisattva awaiting to be born as a Buddha
rank; status, dignity of rank; social hierarchy
derived: rank in the hierarchy of aesthetic or literary excellence
derived: rank in the hierarchy of aesthetic or literary excellence
be given a salaried position or job
positions in the official administrative hiearachy
